CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 11 The mobility of PDTP-DTDPP-(Bu) was measured by using a field - effect transistor ( FET ) with a bottom-gate , top - contact device configuration built on an n - doped silicon wafer. Figure 5 shows the typical output and transfer curves of a representative device with PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) as the channel semiconductor. The hole mobility was estimated to be 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , which is 1-2 orders of magnitude higher than that of other effective D-A type low - bandgap photovoltaic polymers ( 2.6 x 10^-4 -3 x 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). 5 Although the FET mobility might not be directly correlated to the photovoltaic performance since the situation of the charge transport is quite different from each other , the higher carrier mobility still suggests effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes in the photovoltaic devices. Photovoltaic Properties. The bulk heterojunction PSCs were fabricated with the device structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM ( or PC 70 BM ) / LiF / Al. PEDOT : PSS was spin - coated on a precleaned ITO - coated glass substrate. The film was dried at 150 °C under a N 2 atmosphere for 5 min. After cooling the substrate , a solution of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PCBM ( or PC 70 BM ) mixture ( 1 : 2 w / w ) was spin - coated , where a blend of chloroform and o-dichlorobenzene ( 4 : 1 v / v ) was used as the solvent. The devices were completed by evaporating LiF / Al as the cathode. The effective area ( 2 mm x 3 mm ) of the PSCs was defined using a metal photomask during irradiation with simulated solar light ( Scheme 2 ). PC 70 BM was also used as an acceptor because it has similar electronic properties as PCBM , but a higher absorption coefficient in the visible region , which can compensate for the poor absorption of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) in this range. Figure 6 shows the I-V curves of the devices with the best photovoltaic performance under the illumination of AM 1.5 ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The corresponding open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) , short - circuit current ( I SC ) , fill factor ( FF ) , and PCE of the devices are also summarized in Figure 3. The external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of the devices under the illumination of monochromatic light is shown in Figure 3. Compared with the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM system , the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PC 70 BM system has higher EQE values of 30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm , which contributes to the improvement of I SC from 11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2. Since the spectral response extends to over 1.1 μm , the spectral mismatch between the simulated and actual AM1.5 spectra must be considered.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP-DTDPP-(Bu): This is a channel semiconductor in a field-effect transistor and also used as a donor material in photovoltaic cells.
2. n-doped silicon: This is the material of the wafer on which the FET is built.
3. PEDOT:PSS: This is a hole transport material used in the photovoltaic cells.
4. PCBM (or PC 70 BM): This is an acceptor material used in the photovoltaic cells.
5. LiF / Al: This is the cathode material used in the photovoltaic cells.
6. ITO: This is the material of the coated glass substrate used in the photovoltaic cells.
7. Chloroform and o-dichlorobenzene: These are the solvents used in the spin-coating process for the photovoltaic cells.
8. Metal photomask: This is used to define the effective area of the photovoltaic cells during irradiation.

These are the identified "Material Name" entities in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PDTP-DTDPP-(Bu)
2. n-doped silicon
3. PEDOT:PSS
4. PCBM (or PC 70 BM)
5. LiF / Al
6. ITO
7. Chloroform and o-dichlorobenzene

These are the relevant "Material Name" entities in the paragraph.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 11 The mobility of PDTP-DTDPP-(Bu) was measured by using a field - effect transistor ( FET ) with a bottom-gate , top - contact device configuration built on an n - doped silicon wafer. Figure 5 shows the typical output and transfer curves of a representative device with PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) as the channel semiconductor. The hole mobility was estimated to be 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , which is 1-2 orders of magnitude higher than that of other effective D-A type low - bandgap photovoltaic polymers ( 2.6 x 10^-4 -3 x 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ). 5 Although the FET mobility might not be directly correlated to the photovoltaic performance since the situation of the charge transport is quite different from each other , the higher carrier mobility still suggests effective charge carrier transport to the electrodes in the photovoltaic devices. Photovoltaic Properties. The bulk heterojunction PSCs were fabricated with the device structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM ( or PC 70 BM ) / LiF / Al. PEDOT : PSS was spin - coated on a precleaned ITO - coated glass substrate. The film was dried at 150 °C under a N 2 atmosphere for 5 min. After cooling the substrate , a solution of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) and PCBM ( or PC 70 BM ) mixture ( 1 : 2 w / w ) was spin - coated , where a blend of chloroform and o-dichlorobenzene ( 4 : 1 v / v ) was used as the solvent. The devices were completed by evaporating LiF / Al as the cathode. The effective area ( 2 mm x 3 mm ) of the PSCs was defined using a metal photomask during irradiation with simulated solar light ( Scheme 2 ). PC 70 BM was also used as an acceptor because it has similar electronic properties as PCBM , but a higher absorption coefficient in the visible region , which can compensate for the poor absorption of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) in this range. Figure 6 shows the I-V curves of the devices with the best photovoltaic performance under the illumination of AM 1.5 ( 100 mW / cm^2 ). The corresponding open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) , short - circuit current ( I SC ) , fill factor ( FF ) , and PCE of the devices are also summarized in Figure 3. The external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) of the devices under the illumination of monochromatic light is shown in Figure 3. Compared with the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PCBM system , the PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) : PC 70 BM system has higher EQE values of 30-40 % in the range of 450-850 nm , which contributes to the improvement of I SC from 11.31 to 14.87 mA / cm^2. Since the spectral response extends to over 1.1 μm , the spectral mismatch between the simulated and actual AM1.5 spectra must be considered.

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP-DTDPP(Bu): This is a channel semiconductor material used in the field-effect transistor (FET) and also one of the active layers in the bulk heterojunction organic photovoltaic cells (PSCs).
2. n-doped silicon wafer: This is the substrate material for the FET device.
3. PEDOT:PSS: This is a hole transport material used in the PSCs, spin-coated on the ITO-coated glass substrate.
4. PCBM (or PC 70 BM): This is an acceptor material used in the PSCs, blended with PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) in a 1:2 weight ratio. It has similar electronic properties as PCBM but a higher absorption coefficient in the visible region.
5. LiF/Al: This is the cathode material used to complete the PSCs.
6. Chloroform and o-dichlorobenzene: These are the solvents used to prepare the solution of PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) and PCBM (or PC 70 BM) mixture for spin-coating the active layer in the PSCs.
7. ITO (Indium Tin Oxide): This is a transparent electrode material used in the PSCs, coated on a glass substrate.
8. The paragraph also mentions simulated solar light and monochromatic light, which are not materials but sources of illumination for the PSCs.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. PDTP-DTDPP(Bu): channel semiconductor material in FET and active layer material in PSCs.
2. n-doped silicon wafer: substrate material for the FET device.
3. PEDOT:PSS: hole transport material in PSCs.
4. PCBM (or PC 70 BM): acceptor material in PSCs.
5. LiF/Al: cathode material in PSCs.
6. Chloroform and o-dichlorobenzene: solvents used for spin-coating the active layer in PSCs.
7. ITO: transparent electrode material in PSCs.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PDTP-DTDPP(Bu) |
| n-doped silicon wafer |
| PEDOT:PSS |
| PCBM (or PC 70 BM) |
| LiF/Al |
| Chloroform and o-dichlorobenzene |
| ITO |
